content: I'm going to tell you a little bit about how Bitcoin passed through my life 3 times...I worked at a company at night and sold video games in Paraguay during the day at the beginning of the last decade and used the rest of the morning/free time to read about different topics on the internet, trying to make good deals, make good purchases abroad, etc.Until one day when searching I found a foreign website (I don't remember which one) that accepted Bitcoins and sold some retro games that I considered good products, at the time Bitcoin cost a little more than 1 dollar, and as I had access to buy with It was easier to use dollars via PayPal and it didn't make much sense for me to pay more with Bitcoin, this was my first contact and my biggest regret.¬†I didn't pay attention and I didn't have the sensitivity and knowledge to see the opportunity that passed by me...Many years later, Bitcoin appeared randomly in my random searches on the most diverse subjects, it was worth 4000 USD. I was going through turbulent times financially and it never crossed my mind to have that amount on hand, after all, in my ignorance I imagined that you could only buy 1 BTC and not fractions of Sats, in short, it took me many, many years to get really interested and come to truly understand the power of decentralization and the revolution that is Bitcoin.¬†The third and last time it came into my life was through the bull run boom, where everyone was talking about it. I lost a lot of money due to lack of knowledge. At this point I decided to stop and study, delve deeper and try to definitively understand what BTC was and for me it was one of the best decisions I've made in recent times in my life, it gave me peace of mind, opened my mind, gave me views on the world and about the things that completely transformed me into a better person.¬† ¬† I was able to understand what true freedom is and the countless possibilities it can bring.¬† ¬† I understood that a person has to decide their own destiny, it is their responsibility alone. Don't outsource things, don't play the victim, in short, be the protagonist of your own life, Bitcoin and what it represents simply frees you and gives you an incredible mental expansion. I just have to be grateful for having known you. Could it have been earlier in my wanderings on the internet? Yes... I've already blamed myself so much for this, but there's nothing to do, simply each person in their own time, that's how life is, that's what makes it beautiful. Each one living in their own time.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: To be honest with you, you have chosen a terrible title for your thread, as it is reminiscent of Hal's, who neither you nor your story can keep up with. Then separate the text into paragraphs, please. Finally, you go from telling us how you are interested in Bitcoin only for the pure economic interest (nothing about decentralization, hashrate security and things like that) to saying that it has made you a better person, which in principle has no causal relationship, Well, there were famous people on the forum who ended up scamming, for example.Surely you expect merits or congratulations for your story but for my part you are not going to get them because of the above.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: No offense Op your thread seems sentimental you only talked more about the profit side of Bitcoin but didn't talk about decentralization, anonymity and other key properties of what make Bitcoin unique.In conclusion your thread seems more like this thread;Bitcoin and me (Hal Finney) made by the legendary Hal who was one of the earliest adopter and supporter of Bitcoin .I suggest you check it out do you can get better insights.Don't forget to keep your keys safe mate üòÅ

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: Bitcoin has a lot than profit and it wasn't created for it to be an investment but rather as an alternative payment method through p2p, and to also give people financial freedom from the government by making them to be their own bank. I think that is the major purpose and biggest benefit which is her decentralized nature. From what you said, it means that if bitcoin price dips down below your entry point and stays for long, you wouldn't call it the best thing that has happened to you. The profit should be seen as the secondary benefit because it was the decentralized nature that made so many people to adopt bitcoin in the early days, but from what I have observed now most people adopting bitcoin are only after making profit and that is why they end up buying when the price is high and before they know it, when bitcoin price dips below their entry point, they will panic and sell and run at loss.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: It's inspiring that even though the op missed some opportunities and lost money, the overall impact of Bitcoin on op's life is positive. Bitcoin itself is just a currency, but it's true that when diving a bit into how it's different from fiat and what kind of ideas it implements, you can learn a lot and rethink how freedom looks like and what kind of freedom is possible.I'm not sure whether Bitcoin is the greatest invention after the Internet because it's hard to pick one thing like that for me, but Bitocin is a practical application of libertarian economic ideas, and I'm glad that we have it around.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: You've been through the highs and lows of Bitcoin. Your story gives digital money a face. It's both interesting and scary to think about how Bitcoin can get away. Because we are aware, we value them more later.¬†Your first experience with Bitcoin, which you skipped over for ease of use, is typical. People like consistency more than uncertainty. As usual, lack of money kept people from participating. Lost chances are not mistakes; they are stepping stones. They helped you learn about yourself and Bitcoin.¬†You have a great understanding of how Bitcoin gives us power to change our future. You've taken on Bitcoin's personality and duties, not just its money. Remember that everyone's path is unique; yours was necessary for progress. Take what you've learned and keep going.

comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: Not only are you regretting it, but everyone who didn't even know about Bitcoin at the time and didn't invest is now regretting it even more.¬† If I had bought some bitcoins when I saw the price of bitcoins, I might have had a lot more bitcoin investment today and I would have made a lot of profit. At the time when you came to know about Bitcoin, the price of Bitcoin was 1 dollar but you looked at 1 dollar as big because at that time we did not see so much popularity or so much potential of this coin. It would be wrong to say that you didn't have a dollar because if you had known then that Bitcoin could come to such a state, you would have managed a dollar or a few dollars and bought Bitcoin. There is no point in worrying about what happened in the past. We think about the present. We can invest in Bitcoin with the idea that the price of Bitcoin can reach 100,000 dollars from the current state of Bitcoin price.
